DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Conservaзгo preventiva de plumбrias indнgenas em acervos museolуgicos: avaliaзгo das condiзхes de conservaзгo dos adornos plumбrios Kaapor na coleзгo etnogrбfica do Museu Paraense Emнlio Goeldi

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenaзгo de Aperfeiзoamento de Pessoal de Nнvel Superior

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Atividades ligadas ao patrimфnio cultural e ambiental

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Os adornos plumбrios sгo parte integrante da cultura material de diversos grupos indнgenas brasileiros. Guardados em museus, acervos de plumбria necessitam de cuidados especiais que permitam uma longevidade a este material de extrema fragilidade. Apesar desta vulnerabilidade e da importвncia da preservaзгo destes objetos ainda sгo incipientes as pesquisas de conservaзгo desta matйria, principalmente no Brasil. Sendo assim, partindo do conceito de Conservaзгo Preventiva, este trabalho objetivou adequar o modelo de Pearlstein (2017) para avaliar o estado de conservaзгo adornos plumбrios salvaguardados na Reserva Tйcnica Curt Nimuendajъ, do Museu Paraense Emнlio Goeldi. Para isso, buscou-se conhecer as propriedades materiais e tйcnicas da plumбria; conhecer o acervo de plumбria e as condiзхes de salvaguarda presentes nesta reserva tйcnica, aplicar os modelos e gerar resultados que possam ser comparados temporalmente, em pesquisas futuras, permitindo avaliar se houve alteraзгo qualitativa nas condiзхes de conservaзгo do acervo. Sendo assim, o Modelo de avaliaзгo das condiзхes de conservaзгo dos adornos plumбrios MACCAP estб dividido em cinco seзхes: identificaзгo, tйcnicas, materiais, mapeamento de danos e condiзхes de salvaguarda. No caso em estudo foram selecionados 40 adornos da etnia Kaapor, distribuнdos em 8 coleзхes formadas entre 1900 e 1985, sendo os resultados do modelo compilados para esse conjunto. Os resultados demonstram estar este acervo em boas condiзхes de conservaзгo, porйm com ressalvas a serem feitas tanto em termos de documentaзгo, organizaзгo, quanto de conservaзгo das as peзas jб fragilizadas. O estudo conclui indicando a necessidade de mais pesquisas e trocas de experiкncias sobre a conservaзгo de um material tгo especнfico, sobretudo entre as instituiзхes museolуgicas brasileiras.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The feather adornments are a part of the material culture of several Brazilian indigenous groups. Saved in museums, collections of featherwork need special care that allow longevity to this material of extreme fragility. Despite this vulnerability and the importance of the preservation of these objects are still incipient the researches of conservation of this matter, mainly in Brazil. Therefore, starting from the concept of Preventive Conservation, this work aimed to adjusting the Pearlstein model (2017) to evaluate the conservation status of feathered adornments safeguarded at the Curt Nimuendajъ Storage Room, of the Museu Paraense Emнlio Goeldi. For this, it was sought to know the material and technical properties of the featherwork; know the featherwork collection and the conditions of safeguard present in this Storage Room, apply the models and generate results that can be compared temporally in future research, allowing to evaluate if there was a qualitative change in the conservation conditions of the collection. Therefore, the Model of evaluation of the conditions of conservation of feather adornments MACCAP is divided into five sections: identification, techniques, materials, damage mapping and safeguard conditions. To test its applicability within the Storage Room, were selected 40 Ka'apor ornaments distributed in 8 collections formed between 1900 and 1985. The results demonstrate that this collection is in good conservation condition, but with reservations to be made both in terms of documentation, organization and practices that allow greater care with fragile pieces. The study concludes the need for more studies and exchanges of experiences on the conservation of such a specific material, especially among Brazilian museological institutions.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The thesis discusses application of thermal and fluid dynamic computational simulations of indoor climate variables, as diagnostic tools aiming preventive conservation of collections. It debates how simulation results can be used for obtaining measurable and comparable parameters - preservation metrics - and the practical use of such metrics in preventive conservation, with focus on their relationship with natural ventilation. The choosen case study is the Chapel of Last Supper in Congonhas, Minas Gerais, Brazil. The building houses wood sculptures by the main Brazilian baroque sculptor, Aleijadinho. 

The objective of tthe theis is to discuss the applicability of computer simulations of indoor climate variables as diagnostic tools aiming preventive conservation of collections. It intends to demonstrate, by means of a case study, how the results of computer simulations can be used for obtaining preservation metrics and how such metrics can be used as diagnostic tools in preventive conservation with focus on their relationship with natural ventilation. 

2. Main body of text (750 words)

2.1. Objective

The objective of this paper is to discuss the applicability of computer simulations of indoor climate variables as diagnostic tools aiming preventive conservation of collections. It intends to demonstrate, by means of a case study, how the results of computer simulations can be used for obtaining preservation metrics and how such metrics can be used as diagnostic tools in preventive conservation with focus on their relationship with natural ventilation. 

The methodology includes:
Preparation and benchmarking of sensors;
Continuous in situ environmental monitoring (temperature and relative humidity) during 15 months;
Processing of field measured and meteorological data; 
Determination of ?safe? limits of environmental fluctuations for the case study by Bratasz-Koslowski and Camuffo-Pagan methods;
Determination of potential use of natural ventilation for

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: (trabalho final de curso do aluno Antфnio de Oliveira Mello Jr., Fundaciуn Antorchas - Argentina) APRESENTAЗГO Este relatуrio avalia as condiзхes do imуvel-sede da Fundaзгo Cultural Ema Gordon Klabin (FCEGK) e da coleзгo que ele abriga, tendo como objetivo a sua abertura а visitaзгo pъblica. Abordando, principalmente, o problema do impacto ambiental na coleзгo, apresenta diretrizes para a adaptaзгo do edifнcio а funзгo de museu e para a conservaзгo do acervo. Dividido em quatro partes, o trabalho descreve, inicialmente, o edifнcio e o entorno no qual estб inserido. Em seguida, analisa a resposta do edifнcio a este entorno, avalia os riscos e a seguranзa do acervo nele contido. Finalmente, й avaliada a coleзгo, o seu estado de conservaзгo e a relaзгo deste com suas condiзхes de uso e manutenзгo. Para cada um destes aspectos sгo sugeridas medidas para a minoraзгo da possнvel deterioraзгo do acervo estudado, sempre tendo em vista a conservaзгo preventiva ligada ao gerenciamento ambiental do museu.
